title: Analysis of Interaction Between Multimedia Production Competencies and Design Decisions of Instructional Designers: Practice in Designing Mathematics Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Instructional Design Theory and Mathematics Curriculum Content Knowledge
context.additional_context: Learners (students or job seekers) experience designing mobile-optimized microlearning content based on advanced mathematics domain expertise

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the impact of multimedia production competencies on design decisions in the instructional design process
Learners can evaluate peers' design decision patterns using the Design Aloud Protocol technique in the design process analysis
When designing mathematics microlearning content, learners can recognize initial media selection biases and apply verification procedures using analysis phases

resources: Digital Resource Collection for Mathematics Education

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
